IN THE DAYS OF THE APOSTLES

     THE BEGINNING OF THE CHRISTIAN ERA WAS MARKED BY THE OUTPOURING OF THE HOLY SPIRIT AND THE MANIFESTATION OF VARIOUS SPIRITUAL GIFTS. AMONG THESE WAS THE GIFT OF PROPHECY. IN THE BOOK OF ACTS WE READ OF THE INSPIRED UTTERANCES OF PETER, OF STEPHEN, AND OF OTHERS CONNECTED WITH THE EARLY CHRISTIAN CHURCH; ALSO OF THE FOUR DAUGHTERS OF PHILIP, "VIRGINS, WHICH DID PROPHESY;" AND OF A PROPHET NAMED AGABUS. ACTS 21:9, 10.
